description: Quick link for the classic number. Can't belive someone owns 867-5309.com and isn't doing this with it.

links.name: Django Notes And Tutorials
description: I struggled a lot with the offical Django Tutorial. These are notes, boilerplates, and tutorials I put toghter to teach myself (and hopefully make it easier for other folks to learn).

links.name: Color Scheme Switcher (Vanilla JavaScript)
description: Some vanilla JavaScript designed to switch color schemes while preventing a Flash Of Unstyled Content (FOUC).

links.name: Decovar Random
description: This is the second experiment (that I like better) of randomly adjusting a variables on a variable font. This one is Decovar. (The first was Roboto Flex which is linked below).

links.name: Roboto Random
description: This is an experiment with the Roboto Flex variable font. Every second and a half, one of the thirteen adjustable parameters is updated randomly

links.name: Blender Chess Pieces
description: I started playing around with Blender to give me something to do that's not coding. Sure, it's still on a computer, but it kicks the visual part of my brain into gear which is a nice change of pace.

links.name: Fonts and Colors
description: I'm not good at color swabs or fonts in isolation. I built this so I don't have to be. Changes show up directly on the page.

links.name: The Art Of Alan
description: Historically, I've been a photographer. These days, I'm getting into Processing and Blender. This is where I'm posting those pieces.

links.name: alanwsmith.com
description: The place where it all began. This is my main site/blog. It's personal so I post about whatever happens to have my interest. Music, movies, code, having bipolar disorder, whatever. It's also not organized right now. It's just an alphabetical listing of links. Improving that is definitely on the to-do list.

links.name: Are You Currently Alive
description: Build this one in the spirit of Has The Large Hadron Collider Destroyed The World Yet.com for Netlify's 2021 Dusty Domains. The little page was worth $500 to charity.

links.name: ASCII Art
description: A few famous pieces of art turned into ASCII. This is one of five experiments in making a site out of just HTML. There's no JavaScript, CSS, or image calls. Just the HTML. The idea came from this tweet from whitep4nth3r about HTML only web sites.

links.name: AWS API Price List Values
description: I had to dig through the AWS pricing APIs while working on an EC2 pricing comparison for blender rendering. It took a while to figure out how to get at the data. This is the initial data set you can use to filter requests. Hoping it helps save folks some time by not having to bang their heads against this part themselves.

links.name: The Name(s) Of My New Band
description: I'm always on the look out for band names. I've started collecting them here

links.name: Bright Screen Flash Alert
description: Designed primarily for streams who work in dark mode. This plays a little yelling sound for chat when they hit a page without it.

links.name: Cloudinary Image Maker
description: I got tired of trying to assemble Cloudinary urls. Took less time to make this than I spent trying to figure out how to apply text to an image by hand.

links.name: D3 Playground
description: A place to mess around with D3. Just getting started on this one: TODO: Move this one to d3-cookbook

links.name: Your Device Pixel Ratio
description: A single serving site that shows your current Device Pixel Ratio

links.name: EC2 Blender Renderer
description: Taking a look at what it would cost to use Amazon AWS EC2 cloud computers to render Blender 3D images

links.name: EC2 Simplified Price List
description: I finally got fed up with how difficult it is to figure out EC2 pricing so I put this together. (The specific goal at the time was to price out the different GPU instances to look at blender rendering.)

links.name: Hacking
description: This is what hacking looks like. Also, another site that got 500 for charity as part of Dusty Domains

links.name: Horsevatars
description: An experiment in making multi-color avatars for Frontend Horse

links.name: HTML Only Animation
description: The forth experiment in the series six of making site/pages relying on only HTML without JavaScript, CSS, or images. This one produces an animation effect by using meta redirect tags to cycle between pages. (Note that you may have to close the page to stop it)

links.name: HTML Only Display Board
description: This was the fifth of the six experiments is seeing what can be done with only HTML (no JavaScript, CSS, or images). It uses the deprecated marquee tag to create a scrolling text display

links.name: HTML Only Maze
description: Another of the six experiments to see what can be done with HTML alone. No JavaScript. No CSS. Just tags (including some deprecated ones)

links.name: HTML Only Random Pattern
description: A grid with random colors. The sixth experiment with no javascript, css, or images

links.name: Ideas, Ideas, Ideas!
description: A collection of ideas for programming projects if you need something to help get you started

links.name: The Shiny Blog Of Jack Torrance
description: An homage to The Shining. It's also what I had my site doing way back in 2001

links.name: JavaScript Playground
description:
A place for me to mess around with javascript to create snippets for
both understanding how things work and to use to copy into other code

links.name: Links Page
description:
Pointers to my tools, projects, and playgrounds and a pitch for making
sub-domain digital gardens. But you already know that since you're looking at the page :-)

links.name: Letters, Letters, Letters!
description: You're number one source for links to my letters of the alphabet sites. I made them as part of my "How To Grow Your Digital Garden With Sub-Domains" post. (Here's direct letter access if you're looking for that: a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i, j, k, l, m, n, o, p, q, r, s, t, u, v, w, x, y, z. )

links.name: Manic Scroll
description:
A sample of the notes that I took during a manic bipolar episode.
There's nothing particularly profound about them. Just thought it
might be interesting to post them

links.name: Markdown Table Maker
description:
A super basic table formatter for markdown. Eventually, I'll make it
live update and add more features, but it's handy as it is. (Though, I
really need to add dark mode)

links.name: The Million Portrait Project
description:
It's been on hiatus, and doesn't have a lot there yet, but this is my
long term photography project. (Fair warning that the site isn't
          responsive. I didn't know how to do that when I made it)

links.name: Minecraft Notes
description:
My basic collection of minecraft notes so I don't have to look them up
every time. Another plain HTML file site that I'll be adding some
    style too

links.name: MonoCrack
description: A little game where you decrypt texts (Currently Offline)

links.name: Next.js Playground
description: My place to mess around with NextJs to figure out how it works - TODO: Move to Next.js Cookbook

links.name: ngrok Quick QR Code
description: A quick place to send ngrok urls to your phone via qr codes

links.name: photos.alanwsmith.com
description:
Photography used to be my thing. It's what I was known for long before
I got into code. During the years of getting my ass kicked by mental
health issues, it left me. It was gone so long I''d gotten used
to the idea that it was gone forever. Now, it's back. This is
where I'm posting my stuff

links.name: HTML Only Pixel Art
description:
This is an experiment to make pixel art using only an HTML table. It's
one of six using no JavaScript, CSS, or images. Just the HTML. It was
inspired by
<a href="https://twitter.com/whitep4nth3r/status/1510568114966171649"
>this tweet from whitep4nth3r</a
>

links.name: The Pod Of Alan Podcast
description:
Home of The Pod Of Alan where I riff on working in public, making
stuff, creativity, art, design, education, learning, language, mental
health, movies, and music

links.name: QR Code Clock
description:
I wanted to see what would happen if you encoded time into a QR code.
This is it

links.name: Reader For Docs
description:
The idea behind this one is to make it easier for me to read
documentation. Or, really, to keep my place when I'm reading through
docs. Right now it's just the Org-mode manual split into individual
pages. The key is that it remembers what page I'm on so I just open
the site and pick up where I left off.

links.name: Roll. Tide. Roll.
description:
Gotta have a Roll Tide site. On the TODO list is to figure out the
code that keeps all the words in view while filling the page as much
as possible

links.name: The Slides Of Alan
description: Gonna start putting slide decks here for talks and videos

links.name: Static HTML Site Template
description:
My basic template for starting sites without frameworks. Has sample
favicons and Open Graph image calls and will eventually have CSS and
JS samples

links.name: SurfTech.tv
description:
This is a little project I built for myself so that when I've got a
some time to watch a tech video during lunch I don't have to worry
about finding one. This just plays a random one for me. Still have a
bunch of features to add to this, but the basic functionality is nice

links.name: Tailwind Playground
description: Messing around with TailwindCSS to figure out how things work

links.name: Tutorial Thoughts
description:
I find most coding tutorials frustrating. This is my place to
experiment with layouts, designs, and concepts that work with the way
my brain works

links.name: Typing Rust
description: This is my original Rust Notes site where I was going to have a tool to help you type code examples in correctly. I'm punting on it in favor of Rust Notes.

links.name: Rust Notes
description: My collection of notes for learning Rust. Publishing the entire set as a stand alone site to help me learn better through the process of writing.

links.name: Yabai Automation
description: I use Yabai as a tiling window manager on my mac. This page has some scripts I use to automatically move windows around based on which monitors I have connected and what I'm doing
